com.thinkaurelius.faunus

Class FaunusPipeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thinkaurelius.faunus.FaunusPipeline

  • public class FaunusPipeline
extends Object
    A FaunusPipeline defines a breadth-first traversal through a property graph represented. Gremlin/Faunus compiles down to a FaunusPipeline which is ultimately a series of MapReduce jobs.
    Author:
    Marko A. Rodriguez (http://markorodriguez.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • _

        public FaunusPipeline _()
        The identity step does not alter the graph in anyway. It has the benefit of emitting various useful graph statistic counters.
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • order

        public FaunusPipeline order(com.tinkerpop.pipes.transform.TransformPipe.Order order,
                   String elementKey)
        Order the previous property value results and emit them with another element property value. It is important to emit the previous property with a provided type else it is ordered lexigraphically.
        Parameters:
        order - increasing and descending order
        elementKey - the key of the element to associate it with
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • order

        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • back

        public FaunusPipeline back(String step)
        Go back to an element a named step ago. Currently only backing up to vertices is supported.
        Parameters:
        step - the name of the step to back up to
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • simplePath

        public FaunusPipeline simplePath()
        Emit the element only if it was arrived at via a path that does not have cycles in it.
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • sideEffect

        public FaunusPipeline sideEffect(String closure)
        Emit the element, but compute some sideeffect in the process. For example, mutate the properties of the element.
        Parameters:
        closure - the sideeffect closure whose results are ignored.
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • as

        Name a step in order to reference it later in the expression.
        Parameters:
        name - the string representation of the name
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • linkIn

        public FaunusPipeline linkIn(String label,
                    String step,
                    String mergeWeightKey)
        Have the elements for the named step previous project an edge to the current vertex with provided label. If a merge weight key is provided, then count the number of duplicate edges between the same two vertices and add a weight. No weight key is specified by "_" and then all duplicates are merged, but no weight is added to the resultant edge.
        Parameters:
        step - the name of the step where the source vertices were
        label - the label of the edge to project
        mergeWeightKey - the property key to use for weight
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • linkIn

        public FaunusPipeline linkIn(String label,
                    String step)
        Have the elements for the named step previous project an edge to the current vertex with provided label.
        Parameters:
        step - the name of the step where the source vertices were
        label - the label of the edge to project
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • linkOut

        public FaunusPipeline linkOut(String label,
                     String step,
                     String mergeWeightKey)
        Have the elements for the named step previous project an edge from the current vertex with provided label. If a merge weight key is provided, then count the number of duplicate edges between the same two vertices and add a weight. No weight key is specified by "_" and then all duplicates are merged, but no weight is added to the resultant edge.
        Parameters:
        step - the name of the step where the source vertices were
        label - the label of the edge to project
        mergeWeightKey - the property key to use for weight
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • linkOut

        public FaunusPipeline linkOut(String label,
                     String step)
        Have the elements for the named step previous project an edge from the current vertex with provided label.
        Parameters:
        step - the name of the step where the source vertices were
        label - the label of the edge to project
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • groupCount

        public FaunusPipeline groupCount()
        Count the number of times the previous element (or property) has been traversed to. The results are stored in the jobs sideeffect file in HDFS.
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline.

      • groupCount

        public FaunusPipeline groupCount(String keyClosure)
        Apply the provided closure to the incoming element to determine the grouping key. The value of the count is incremented by 1 The results are stored in the jobs sideeffect file in HDFS.
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline.

      • groupCount

        public FaunusPipeline groupCount(String keyClosure,
                        String valueClosure)
        Apply the provided closure to the incoming element to determine the grouping key. Then apply the value closure to the current element to determine the count increment. The results are stored in the jobs sideeffect file in HDFS.
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline.

      • drop

        public FaunusPipeline drop()
        Drop all the elements of respective type at the current step. Keep all others.
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

      • keep

        public FaunusPipeline keep()
        Keep all the elements of the respetive type at the current step. Drop all others.
        Returns:
        the extended FaunusPipeline

        public FaunusPipeline script(String scriptUri,
                    String... args)

      • count

        public FaunusPipeline count()
        Count the number of traversers currently in the graph
        Returns:
        the count

            throws Exception

          Boolean showHeader)
            throws Exception

        Parameters:

        showHeader - the Faunus header
        Throws:
